page.title: 11POPULATION-GROWTH OF PENCOED
page.content: The Parish of Pencoed lies 3 miles north east of Bridgend. It covers an area of 4,000 acres. Most of it is low lying land drained by the river Ewenny. The west and north rises gently to Cefn Hirgoed and Coedymwstwr. Pencoed is close to the M4 and is rapidly growing in size, and has recently been granted town status. The motorway and nearby industries have contributed to this rapid growth with many people travelling daily to either Cardiff or Swansea. Several housing estates have been developed which vary from two bedroom bungalows to large detached dwellings. Unfortunately the population growth has not brought with it an improvement in amenities.
